articles.title: Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Automation Institute of Kim Chaek University of Technology
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Gives Field Guidance to Automation Institute of Kim Chaek University of Technology
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to a newly-built building of the Automation Institute of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					 He was greeted on the spot by Hwang Pyong So, Kim Jong Gwan, other officials of the relevant field and officers of the KPA units taking part in the construction.
					
					 He had promised to make sure that a new building was constructed for the Automation Institute when he was acquainting himself with the work of the institute in April last year.
					
					 He chose the site of the institute on the picturesque bank of the River Taedong and guided its layout several times. He not only saw to it that a powerful construction force of the People's Army was formed for the project but personally settled the issues arising in it.
					
					 Enjoying a bird's-eye view of the institute, he said the institute was successfully built to match the environment around it as required by the layout ratified by the party.
					
					 He went round several places of the institute to learn about its construction in detail.
					
					 He was pleased that the institute was built in such a way as to visually showcase the party's policies of attaching importance to science and technology and talents and provide its researchers with ample conditions for their scientific researches and living. 
					
					 He told officials to fully provide the institute with reading rooms, e-library and video system so that they might help the researchers in their work and study.
					
					 Noting that a country can prosper only when a revolution is carried out with a proper view and stand on science and talents, he underscored the need to provide the institute with modern equipment and vehicles necessary for its operation as it was built into a cutting-edge scientific research center.  He was so kind as to promise to ensure that this matter would be settled by the party.
					
					 He highly praised the soldier builders of KPA units 407 and 101 for fully displaying the revolutionary soldier spirit in the construction of the institute.
					
					 He expressed belief that the researchers of the institute would creditably perform their mission and duty as standard-bearers in breaking through the cutting-edge science and technology by carrying forward the tradition in which they have contributed to the cause of the party with their valuable scientific and technological achievements and thus give fuller play to their patriotic enthusiasm and devotion to living up to the expectations of the party, the country and its people.

articles.title: WPK Greets Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
WPK Greets Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) Friday sent a message of greeting to the National Council of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea on the occasion of its 29th founding anniversary.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the WPK and the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea would grow stronger and sincerely wished the party greater success in its work for the strengthening of the party and the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Belarusian President
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Friday sent a message of greeting to Aleksandr Lukashenko, president of the Republic of Belarus, on its national day.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president of Belarus good health and the government and people of the country bigger successes in their work for the progress and prosperity of the country under the leadership of the president.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Greets Belarusian FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Greets Belarusian FM
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Friday sent a message of greeting to Vladimir Makei, foreign minister of the Republic of Belarus, on its national day.
					 Expressing belief that the two foreign ministries will get closer on a new higher stage of their work in strengthening ties and cooperation for better relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries, the message wished the foreign minister of Belarus bigger successes in his work for the development of the external relations of the country.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Farming in North Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Makes Field Survey of Farming in North Hwanghae Province
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of farming in North Hwanghae Province.
					 He looked round the Phyongam Co-op Farm, Phyongam and Singok reservoirs in Koksan County and the construction site of Wangdang Reservoir No. 2 in Singye County to learn in detail about the manuring and cultivation of crops, securing of water and economic effectiveness of the structure of reservoirs. And he held a consultative meeting. It said that to fully supply water to Miru Plain is an important work to glorify eternally the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. It stressed the need to enhance the role of agricultural workers in increasing agricultural production and manage water way in a responsible manner and took measures to secure all water by stepping up reservoir projects.
					
					 Earlier, he went to the Pomology Institute under the Academy of Agricultural Science and the Central Tree Nursery under the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection. He underscored the need to turn all mountains into treasure ones clad in fruits and nuts and produce and supply saplings of good species, true to the last instructions of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the noble intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Danish PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Danish PM
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Lars Loekke Rasmussen on his appointment as prime minister of Denmark on July 1. 
					 Expressing the belief that the bilateral relations will continue to favorably develop, the message wished the prime minister success in his work. 
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Kristian Jensen on his appointment as foreign minister of Denmark on the same day.

articles.title: Group of Lenin Young Communist League of Russia Leaves
articles.content:
Group of Lenin Young Communist League of Russia Leaves
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A group of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation for tour of the area of Mt. Paektu led by Yevgeni Lashenko, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the league, left here for home on Friday.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Meet
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Meet
 Nampho, July 3 (KCNA) -- A meeting of foreign crewmen for remembering President Kim Il Sung took place at Nampho Port on Friday on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 The participants laid bunches of flowers before a mosaic portraying the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu in Nampho City and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 Earlier, they looked round photos documenting the revolutionary career of the President.
					
					 The meeting was attended by captains and crewmen of the Thailand-flagged ship Nordana Andrea and the Panama-flagged ships.

articles.title: Three Principles for Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Three Principles for Korea's Reunification
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- It is 43 years since the north and the south of Korea have adopted the July 4 Joint Statement in Juche 61 (1972), the keynote of which is the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity.
					 The three principles are a result of President Kim Il Sung's sustained and devoted efforts for national reunification.
					
					 In August 1971 the President proposed wide-range dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south of Korea, declaring that the DPRK was ready to have contacts at any time with all political parties, including the ruling Democratic Republican Party, social organizations and individuals of south Korea.
					
					 And he met with a delegate of south Korea visiting Pyongyang to attend the north-south high-level political talks in May next year. At the meeting he clarified the three principles for Korea's reunification, stressing that the country's reunification should be achieved independently without outsiders' interference and peacefully on the basis of promoting great national unity.
					
					 Consequently, the July 4 North-South Joint Statement reflecting the three principles came into the world, arousing full support and admiration from among all Koreans and the world people.
					
					 As soon as the joint statement adopted, a large number of political parties and organizations in south Korea issued statements in support of it. And media described the three principles as the supreme idea transcending all isms and the best and shortest way for national reunification.
					
					 The three principles advanced by the President still serve as the "compass of reunification", enjoying full support of the entire nation for their validity and vitality.

articles.title: Battle on Mt. Songak
articles.content:
Battle on Mt. Songak
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Mt. Songak, located in the north of Kaesong City, the DPRK, is no more than 490 meters high above the sea level but is a strategic and tactical point as it sits near the Pyongyang-Seoul road and the road reaching to the central part of Korea.
					In the mountain, a unit of the Korean People's Security Forces (KPSF) repulsed a series of armed attacks made by the south Korean puppet army in Juche 38 (1949). 
					
					 Korea was liberated from the Japanese colonial rule on August 15, 1945, but it was divided into the north and the south due to the U.S. military occupation of south Korea. At that time, the puppet army of Syngman Rhee had committed military provocations against the north in the area of Mt. Songak in a bid to unleash a war against the DPRK.
					
					In the battle on the mountain, the KPSF unit killed and captured nearly 1 000 enemies and destroyed and seized a large number of combat and technical equipment.
					
					It is a historical lesson drawn from the battle on the Mt. Songak that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppets will meet only death if they dare provoke the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Denounces S. Korean Puppet Regime's Foolish "Sanctions"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Denounces S. Korean Puppet Regime's Foolish "Sanctions"
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime took a measure for independent "financial sanctions against the north" on June 26.
					 It is claiming that the measure is aimed at "deterring the north from earning foreign currency and introducing military hardware" and, furthermore, this constitutes a step for "putting stronger pressure for bringing about its changes".
					
					 This is ridiculous enough to make even a cough laugh.
					
					 The DPRK has remained undeterred for the past several decades even in face of the harshest and most outrageous moves of the U.S. to isolate and stifle it.
					
					 Even the boss of the imperialists dared not provoke the DPRK. It is, therefore, the height of folly for the puppet forces to try to lead the DPRK to "changes" by showing off a paltry amount of money though they barely prolong their remaining days with the U.S. backing.
					
					 They must know with nothing they can "lead the north to changes" as they stand politically and militarily weak as compared with the north.
					
					 Yet, they are more desperately resorting to unrealizable scenario.
					
					 Why?
					
					 What is most urgent for the puppet forces is to tide over the daily deepening ruling crisis.
					
					 This crisis is caused by the MERS case sweeping across south Korea, the puppet regime's unpopular rule, its moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorshipï¼Œ confrontation and conflict festering between the ruling and opposition political forces and the mounting resentment of the people.
					
					 Much upset by this, it is employing a trite method. It is running the whole gamut of intrigues to divert elsewhere the angry public mindset by pushing the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase and increasing the danger of war in a bid to weather its ruling crisis and get rid of the pretty fix.
					
					 The independent "financial sanctions against the north" are part of those artifices.
					
					 The puppet forces are, however, miscalculating.
					
					 The "financial sanctions" are a manifestation of the most offensive confrontation policy in the absence of direct armed attack, as recognized even by south Korean media.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are highly alerted to deal deadly retaliatory blows at the puppet regime driving the inter-Korean relations into a collapse and gravely threatening peace and stability on the Korean peninsula after raising a hue and cry over "sanctions" and "pressure" in league with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The puppet forces should bear in mind that such foolish row as "financial sanctions" would make it more difficult for them to prolong their remaining days, much less staying in power.
					
					 The reckless moves to escalate the confrontation would only precipitate their self-destruction.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns of Consequences to Be Entailed by THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns of Consequences to Be Entailed by THAAD Deployment in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. persists in grumbling about "nuclear and missile threats" from the DPRK in a bid to justify deployment of its THAAD in south Korea.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The real aim the U.S. administration is seeking through THAAD deployment in south Korea is to carry out its Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 Grave will be consequences to be entailed by THAAD deployment whose signs are already on show.
					
					 The U.S. is forcing the south Korean puppet forces to introduce THAAD, touching off fiercer arms race and sophisticated weapons development race in Asia-Pacific. THAAD now under development by the U.S. is by no means for coping with "threats" from the DPRK but it targets big powers in Asia-Pacific.
					
					 Not only the U.S. but also big powers in the region are vying to develop supersonic missiles. The U.S., which is keen on holding an unchallenged military edge over other countries, is busy to keep big powers from developing the supersonic missiles, being fretful about it.
					
					 It is as clear as pikestaff that if THAAD is deployed in south Korea, this will spark off fiercer race for developing ultra-modern striking weapons among big powers.
					
					 THAAD deployment in south Korea will drastically increase military tension between the countries around the DPRK and the U.S. If a conflict occurs, south Korea will be the first target of the DPRK's neighboring countries as it has turned into a forefront base and advanced nuclear base for carrying out its American master's Asia-Pacific strategy. For this reason the Korean peninsula may turn into a flash point of a new world war, quite contrary to the aspiration and desire of all Koreans for peace.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Poor Burlesque of S. Korean Defense Minister
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Poor Burlesque of S. Korean Defense Minister
Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, south Korean puppet Minister of Defense Han Min Gu in a "memorial address" at a "ceremony" marking the 2002 West Sea armed conflict claimed the "second Yonphyong naval battle was one of victory which held off the north's provocation and demonstrated the will".
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 At the poor burlesque, where defeat was painted as victory, a spate of ridiculous jargon of loser was heard.
					
					 It is a far-fetched assertion that the puppet group talked about the "provocation from the north" when referring to the armed conflict in the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 It is understood that the traitor is an idiot and war maniac unable to draw a lesson from the defeat. The traitor, however, went pompous about "provocation from the north" and "victorious naval battle", a thing that can never be overlooked.
					
					 His rubbish goes to clearly prove that the puppet group persistently seeks stand-off with the north through fresh military provocations by abusing the armed conflict in the West Sea.
					
					 Clear is the conclusion that can be drawn from the present situation in which the south Korean puppet forces have gone desperate in their war hysteria against the north. 
					
					 As long as the puppet warmongers are allowed to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and whip up war hysteria, it will never be possible to improve the inter-Korean relations and it will incur only military conflict and war.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Distorting Truth about Young Joblessness
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Distorting Truth about Young Joblessness
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People carried an editorial on July 1.
					 The editorial recalled that the south Korean authorities would make public "general measure for young employment" at a time when the young joblessness has reached the worst phase. 
					
					 It expressed serious concern that the regime's measure is little short of double killing of young unemployed.
					
					 Nothing will be expected unless the regime and ruling party are judged, the editorial noted, calling for urgent actions of youth.

articles.title: MERS Pandemic Gets Serious in S. Korea
articles.content:
MERS Pandemic Gets Serious in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- MERS has so far claimed 33 lives in south Korea.
					 Fatality by the pandemic has exceeded 18 percent, throwing south Korea into fear and horror.
					
					 Although MERS disaster is on the increase, its infection way has not yet been found and no proper treatment measures are in place.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Rap Japan Chief Executive's Remarks
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Rap Japan Chief Executive's Remarks
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Students in Pusan, south Korea protested outside the Japanese consulate general in Pusan on Wednesday against the remarks made by the Japanese chief executive as regards the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 The students recalled that the Japanese prime minister on June 21 said money would solve the sexual slavery.
					
					 They expressed indignation at the shameless act of the Japanese chief executive who let loose a spate of invectives insulting the victims of sexual slavery, far from making an apology to them.
					
					 They charged that Japan is running headlong into the road of war and threatening peace in Northeast Asia, making no reflection of its past history.
					
					 They urged the Japanese prime minister to make an immediate apology for his remarks and opt for settling the issue of sexual slavery.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Human Rights Racket under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Human Rights Racket under Fire 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Measure Council for Human Rights in South Korea on Friday made public a statement in denunciation of the "2015 white paper on human rights records in the north" issued by the south Korean puppet authorities on July 1. It malignantly hurts the dignity and system of the DPRK. 
					 The "white paper" is nothing but an anti-DPRK conspiratorial document peppered with lies obtained by agents of the Institute for Unification Studies of south Korea from human scum who cooked up them to prolong their remaining days, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 The measure council bitterly denounces the "white paper" as a heinous politically-motivated provocation against the dignity and system of the DPRK and a confrontation racket driving the inter-Korean relations into an extreme phase.
					
					 It is the height of shamelessness and sheer sophism of psychopaths that the south Korean puppet authorities vociferate about "human rights" in the north after turning south Korea into tundra of human rights and a veritable hell. 
					
					 Their anti-DPRK human rights racket is nothing but desperate frenzy of those taken aback by the might of the DPRK where the independent dignity and national power have reached the highest level and its people enjoy all blessings under the wise leadership of the peerlessly great man. It is, at the same time, a revelation of their sinister intention to secure a pretext for calming down the mindset of the angry people by escalating the confrontation between fellow countrymen and realize the wild ambition to stifle the DPRK in cooperation with outside forces. 
					
					 No matter what invectives the fascist dictators may let loose to hurl mud at the fellow countrymen in the north in a bid to cover up their serious human rights abuses, they can never paint a wrong picture of genuine human rights in the DPRK being praised by world people as a land of bliss for people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Austria 
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- An Austrian committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on June 29.
					 Eduard Knapp, chairman of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to arrange political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung and exploits of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of demise of Kim Il Sung (July 8.)

articles.title: Russian Paper Lauds Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Russian Paper Lauds Kim Jong Un
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Selskaya Zhizn on June 18 carried articles illustrated with photos showing the revolutionary activities of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 An article titled "Kim Jong Un's mode of creation" said his creation mode by which he leads the construction of a thriving socialist country is characterized by a high level of keeping up with the world trend, unusual speed, ambitiousness and extensiveness.
					
					 Another article said: The invincibility of socialist Korea lies in the fact that it is led by the great leader, it is based on the Juche idea, outstanding guiding idea, and that the Korean people take socialism as their life and soul. Socialist Korea is getting all the more invincible thanks to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Socialist Korea Introduced in Switzerland
articles.content:
Socialist Korea Introduced in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Socialist Korea turned into a people's paradise and an invincible power that embodied the Juche idea and Songun idea under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 This was said in a statement adopted at an inaugural ceremony of the Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation held on June 27. 
					
					 It noted that Kim Il Sung led the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and liberated the country from the brutal and colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists on August 15, 1945 and founded the WPK, the staff of the Korean revolution, on October 10 that year.
					
					 The Korean people are greeting the significant holidays with high national pride and self-esteem.
					
					 Progressive mankind and adherents to Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism will join the Korean people in grandly celebrating the anniversaries.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days to Be Marked in Switzerland
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days to Be Marked in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation was inaugurated in Basel on June 27.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to post on its website works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and organize colorful political and cultural events praising their exploits between July 1 and October 11.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days to Be Celebrated in Ecuador
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days to Be Celebrated in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- An Ecuadorian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation was formed on June 26.
					 Osvaldo Larriva Alvarado, chairman of the Ecuadorian committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events including a meeting and film show on the anniversaries.

articles.title: Socialist Educational System of DPRK Praised in Senegal
articles.content:
Socialist Educational System of DPRK Praised in Senegal
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A Senegalese paper and broadcasting service praised the most advantageous socialist educational system in the DPRK on June 16. 
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire in an article titled "Features of compulsory education in DPRK" said:
					
					 The universal 12-year compulsory education, the highest level in the world, has been enforced in the DPRK. 
					
					 This system is based on free education in which the state is responsible for everything necessary for education. 
					
					 The characteristic of this system is that it steadily develops education as required by the times and aspires after the most reasonable educational method at the highest level. 
					
					 The universal 12-year compulsory education is the further development of the universal 11-year compulsory education which was enforced in the past and a new high phase of the secondary general educational system, the paper said, introducing the educational system in the DPRK in detail. 
					
					 The Senegalese radio broadcasting service aired the same news.

articles.title: Czech Organization Supports June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Czech Organization Supports June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association made public an information bulletin on June 15 on the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The bulletin carried several articles including "15th Anniversary of Publication of North-South Joint Declaration," "Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War" and "Important View on Situation of Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia" together with photos showing exploits performed by leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Thanks to the great and courageous decision and magnanimity of Kim Jong Il, the inter-Korean summit was provided for the first time in the history of the nation's division and the June 15 joint declaration whose main idea is By Korean Nation Itself was adopted as a programme for independent reunification common to the nation in the new century, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 The north-south joint declaration is the great programme for reconciliation and reunification of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet authorities have ceaselessly launched large-scale aggression war exercises against the DPRK. 
					
					 This is evidently a provocation to the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Germany
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Germany
 Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed by the Communist Party of Germany on June 29.
					 Chairman of the party Torsten Schoevitz was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events praising the exploits of Kim Il Sung on the anniversary of his demise (July 8.)

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre Instituto de Automatizacion de Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre Instituto de Automatizacion de Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el Instituto de Automatizacion de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, construido nuevamente.
					Le acogieron en el terreno Hwang Pyong So, Kim Jong Gwan, los funcionarios de la rama correspondiente y los comandantes de la unidad del EPC movilizada en la construccion.
					
					En abril del ano pasado, el Mariscal averiguo el trabajo del Instituto de Automatizacion, ocasion en la cual prometio construirlo nuevamente.
					
					El mismo definio el solar de construccion en la orilla del pintoresco rio Taedong, dirigio varias veces el plan de conformacion del instituto, hizo movilizar la potente fuerza de construccion del EPC y resolvio personalmente los problemas pendientes en la obra.
					
					Al presenciar el panorama del instituto, dijo que se construyo bien acorde al ambiente de su contorno segun la demanda del plan aprobado por el Partido.
					
					El Mariscal recorrio varios lugares del instituto para cerciorarse en detalles del estado de la obra.
					
					El Instituto de Automatizacion fue construido para que pueda mostrar visualmente la politica de nuestro Partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y tecnica y a las personas  talentosas y asegurar satisfactoriamente el trabajo de investigacion cientifica y la condicion de vida de los investigadores, dijo.
					
					Ordeno acondicionar mejor la sala de lectura, la de libros electronicos y el sistema de vista y audicion de video para que los investigadores puedan dedicarse bien al trabajo y al estudio.
					
					Solo cuando se hace la revolucion junto con el correcto punto de vista y posicion sobre la ciencia y las personas  talentosas prosperara el pais, dijo y continuo que el instituto debe disponerse de los modernos equipos y medios de transporte necesarios a su administracion como base de investigacion sofisticada. Y senalo que el Partido resolvera ese problema.
					
					Y evaluo de alto los meritos de los constructores militares de las unidades 407 y 101 del EPC que manifestaron plenamente el espiritu revolucionario de los militares en la construccion del instituto.
					
					El Mariscal expreso la conviccion de que los investigadores del Instituto de Automatizacion de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek manifestaran mas el fervor patriotico y la abnegacion para responder a la esperanza del Partido, la patria y el pueblo, al heredar la tradicion del tiempo pasado en que apoyaron la causa de nuestro Partido con los valiosos exitos cientificos y tecnicos y cumplir con su mision y obligacion de abanderados en el esfuerzo por alcanzar los niveles de punta.

articles.title: CC del PTC envia mensaje de felicitacion a Partido Democratico de Guinea Ecuatorial
articles.content:
CC del PTC envia mensaje de felicitacion a Partido Democratico de Guinea Ecuatorial
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- El Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea envio el dia 3 un mensaje de felicitacion al Consejo Nacional del Partido Democratico de Guinea Ecuatorial con motivo del 29o aniversario de la fundacion de esta organizacion politica.
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido Democratico de Guinea Ecuatorial se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro, el remitente formula votos por mayores exitos en el trabajo del Partido Democratico de Guinea Ecuatorial para su fortalecimiento y desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Entidad norcoreana rechaza intriga de DDHH anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Entidad norcoreana rechaza intriga de DDHH anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 3 de julio (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que los titeres surcoreanos publicaron el pasado dia primero la "carta blanca de derechos humanos del Norte 2015" calumniando la dignidad y el regimen de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz de la Sociedad de Medidas de DDHH en el Sur de Corea hizo publica el dia 3 una declaracion.
					La nota senala que la "carta blanca de DDHH del Norte" es un documento intrigante anti-RPDC inventado por el Instituto de Unificacion del Sur de Corea con datos falsificados ofrecidos por las escorias humanas para mantener su vida sucia. 
					
					La Sociedad de Medidas de DDHH en el Sur de Corea denuncia la edicion de la "carta blanca de DDHH del Norte" como brutal desafio politico a la dignidad y sistema de la RPDC y proceder intrigante que lleva a la fase extremada la confrontacion Norte-Sur. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos convirtieron el suelo surcoreano en el infierno de derechos humanos y cuestionan la situacion de "DDHH" de alguien, lo cual es el climax del cinismo y la sofisteria de psicopata.
